title: Slow, Ongoing Metamorphosis
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2V1gwVc

by yikesola

They see things at home for ages before they eventually show the internet. Dan’s curly hair, Phil’s glasses, Dan’s hoop earring, Phil’s quiff. And even once they’re ready to show, they do it slowly.
A fic about changes and when we get to see them.

Words: 1405, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Phandom/The Fantastic Foursome (YouTube RPF)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply

  • Additional Tags: 2019, But also, Memory Lane, Introspection

blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: Totally disagree. I am certain "Phan" has huge impact on their IRL relationship. Can you imagine someone dating Dan or Phil? How...
question: Totally disagree. I am certain "Phan" has huge impact on their IRL relationship. Can you imagine someone dating Dan or Phil? How would it look like?  If they went out on a date, there would be dread that someone will see them, and their entire brand might take a hit. And imagine what would happen to their girl/boyfriends. They would be ripped apart by the phandom. I'm sure Phil/Dan are painfully aware of the consequences.
answer: And you might be right. But at the same time, has anybody ever spotted Dan or Phil on a date? With each other, or with anyone else? No? Are we just assuming they’ve both been single for ten years? It’s possible, but I feel it’s unlikely. I would imagine they’ve almost certainly had partners off and on. They probably know the places and the time of day they’re most likely to get spotted or recognized. I don’t know, anon. I imagine Phan is probably the elephant in the room a lot of the time, but I do think it’s entirely possible they’ve had partners that we never knew a thing about.

reblog.comment: And you might be right. But at the same time, has anybody ever spotted Dan or Phil on a date? With each other, or with anyone else? No? Are we just assuming they’ve both been single for ten years? It’s possible, but I feel it’s unlikely. I would imagine they’ve almost certainly had partners off and on. They probably know the places and the time of day they’re most likely to get spotted or recognized. I don’t know, anon. I imagine Phan is probably the elephant in the room a lot of the time, but I do think it’s entirely possible they’ve had partners that we never knew a thing about.

trail.content_raw: And you might be right. But at the same time, has anybody ever spotted Dan or Phil on a date? With each other, or with anyone else? No? Are we just assuming they’ve both been single for ten years? It’s possible, but I feel it’s unlikely. I would imagine they’ve almost certainly had partners off and on. They probably know the places and the time of day they’re most likely to get spotted or recognized. I don’t know, anon. I imagine Phan is probably the elephant in the room a lot of the time, but I do think it’s entirely possible they’ve had partners that we never knew a thing about.
trail.content: And you might be right. But at the same time, has anybody ever spotted Dan or Phil on a date? With each other, or with anyone else? No? Are we just assuming they’ve both been single for ten years? It’s possible, but I feel it’s unlikely. I would imagine they’ve almost certainly had partners off and on. They probably know the places and the time of day they’re most likely to get spotted or recognized. I don’t know, anon. I imagine Phan is probably the elephant in the room a lot of the time, but I do think it’s entirely possible they’ve had partners that we never knew a thing about.

blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: My theory is that they let the phan thing keep going because that way people are focused on that and they can keep any...
question: My theory is that they let the phan thing keep going because that way people are focused on that and they can keep any relationships they have private.
answer: Bingo. I do think that’s probably part of the reason they let it slide. Because if everyone is focused on finding proof that you’re fucking each other, then nobody is really looking for proof that you have a girlfriend or a boyfriend or a hookup on the side. Super easy to hide a partner when literally nobody is asking or looking or even curious.

reblog.comment: Bingo. I do think that’s probably part of the reason they let it slide. Because if everyone is focused on finding proof that you’re fucking each other, then nobody is really looking for proof that you have a girlfriend or a boyfriend or a hookup on the side. Super easy to hide a partner when literally nobody is asking or looking or even curious.

Because if everyone is focused on finding proof that you’re fucking each other, then nobody is really looking for proof that you have a girlfriend or a boyfriend or a hookup on the side. Super easy to hide a partner when literally nobody is asking or looking or even curious.
trail.content: Bingo. I do think that’s probably part of the reason they let it slide. Because if everyone is focused on finding proof that you’re fucking each other, then nobody is really looking for proof that you have a girlfriend or a boyfriend or a hookup on the side. blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: I have that observation (?) that if they were as open as people want, then maybe they could live in peace without most of these...
question: I have that observation (?) that if they were as open as people want, then maybe they could live in peace without most of these dramas? Please don't get me wrong, I know that their personal life isn't our business and I fully respect that, but what I mean is when I'm watching Cristine and she's like Hey, this is Ben, this is my sister, meet my grandma, this is insta story from my grandpa's birthday,  #1
answer:
“this is video from my family holiday and this is video where I did sth crazy with my friends.But you don’t have to know everything about my life. and I think this is perfect. And then there is Colleen. As open as it’s possible. This is my video when I’m talking about my divorce. This is video where I’m giving a birth. Video of my friends drinking my breast milk. This is 1h of instastories. Like this is too much? I love her, but the more content like that she’s giving to us, the less I care. #2”

…

I think the difference with that though, is that people like cristine and Colleen seem comfortable with sharing things about their life and being open. Dan and Phil have never been that way. They’ve never been the type to want to bring their audience in and be open and share all the nitty gritty details. Ever since I’ve been here Dan and Phil have seemed to create a very distinct boundary between “internet fun time” and “actual real life time” and they tend not to mix the two. Probably for a variety of reasons. And I think preserving their privacy or comfort is probably more important to them than making sure a bunch of kids on the internet don’t panic over eye contact.

…

Probably for a variety of reasons. And I think preserving their privacy or comfort is probably more important to them than making sure a bunch of kids on the internet don’t panic over eye contact.
